title: Rate law of NO2 from conc natural log inverse data

content.description:
Time <math alttext="in seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2, in moles per liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>mol</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>L</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="the natural log of the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mtext>[N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="the fraction 1 over the molar concentration of N O 2, end fraction, in liters per mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>L</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 0.693" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.693</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="2.00" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2.00</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.364" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.364</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 1.01" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.01</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="2.75" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.75</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="200" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.286" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.286</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 1.25" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="3.50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="300" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.235" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.235</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 1.45" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.45</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></math>
 <math alttext="4.25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The data from a study of the decomposition of <math alttext="N O 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> to form <math alttext="N O, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2, gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above.
content.question: Which of the following rate laws is consistent with the data?

choices.label: <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the fraction 1 over the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Rate equals k times the fraction 1 over the molar concentration of N O 2, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="Rate equals k times the molar concentration of N O 2, squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
